meanings.definition: Destruction of the natural environment, especially when deliberate.
meanings.sent1: The ecocide caused by the factory's toxic waste was devastating to the local wildlife.
meanings.sent2: The government passed a law to prevent ecocide and protect our forests.
meanings.sent3: The ecocide in the garden was so extreme that even the flowers seemed sad.
meanings.sent4: The ecocide in the ocean turned the once vibrant coral reefs into lifeless skeletons.
meanings.sent5: The images of ecocide in the documentary were haunting and unforgettable.

meanings.definition: The extensive damage to or loss of ecosystems within a given territory.
meanings.sent1: The ecocide of the rainforest led to the extinction of many species.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying the effects of ecocide on biodiversity.
meanings.sent3: The ecocide in the park was so severe that even the squirrels left in protest.
meanings.sent4: The ecocide of the wetlands left a barren landscape where life once thrived.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to prevent further ecocide in their neighborhood.
